Can we deduce the exact form of \\( u(x, 0) = u_0(x) \\) after observing \\( T[u](x, T) \\) for some T > 0, without knowing whether the transformation \\( T[u] \\) was initially applied?
Explanation: The output \\( T[u](x, T) \\) integrates the effects of the initial function \\( u_0 \\) over time with an exponential weighting. As this blending obscures direct characteristics of \\( u_0(x) \\), it's not possible to uniquely regress to the initial condition without knowledge of whether \\( T \\) was applied.
